communications.subject: California Public Records Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Hayward Police Department)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: [Records Center] Welcome to the Records Center!
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau, 
 
Thank you for registering with the City of Hayward. 
 
Your Login ID is:  149636-84180159@requests.muckrock.com 
 
If you did not submit your request through the public portal but are receiving this e-mail, an account has been created for you where you can track and monitor the status of your request, and receive any documents in response to your request. 
 
 
If you have never used this system or cannot remember your password you may request a temporary password here: Request Temporary Password (https://u8387778.ct.sendgrid.net/ls/click?upn=6HtRfOYLt5fXvpttM-2FU1HQf0QhiUY-2FxLTXFZM47qN-2FKci81VaJV0dsluciFmN2LwbqbugQX2OV8hSWm6ZW-2B-2Faa3-2FniF5lymhchrSFxRKync-3DQFXH_A5qPtrWdLjiAx4BkJcTrjkwpSPSwY8XglyIFj-2FxqIecc5qJhssZXvOik2FY-2By-2FShrg7Iizgh9I9W-2FlRlnTwtcyqhKOl14JVfGy5oKpfJavY-2FuqKp-2B3fI2oEb22ZeQMjmZN0NhjzMWdNpUaQnt6FrGQ30PJuAIo8vC9uEm5sshTG0Oyl2VTBx4EZYNrJ3xI8GEKHPkFj1eXd2LIAJQzW9Ml6wpBYhGdBWN1-2FOhCicYmE-3D)

communications.subject: Police Department - Public Records Request :: P000439-072323
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: The Hayward Police Department received a request for police records from you on 7/23/2023. Your request mentioned: 
"To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the California Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 calendar days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

Upload documents directly: https://accounts.muckrock.com/accounts/login/?next=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.muckrock.com%2Faccounts%2Flogin%2F%3Fnext%3D%252Faccounts%252Fagency_login%252Fhayward-police-department-5650%252Fvehicular-pursuit-policy-hayward-police-department-149636%252F%253Femail%253DLeah.Mendes%252540hayward-ca.gov&url_auth_token=AAAa3lO_wgERAnICh8HZJoSe8AY%3A1qNmyF%3A-uhgKL7uCh4WY9QVLnlddtmZil0Q0dny1bKHH8Wfa_Y" Your request has been referred to the appropriate HPD staff for follow-up, and we will provide you with an email response by August 03, 2023. (If your request was received on a weekend or City Holiday, City staff will begin to process your request on the next open business day.) We will send available electronic records through this portal.  If you determine that the records provided do not fulfill your request, please let staff know so that staff may continue to search for responsive documents. Hayward Police Department

title: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Harris County Sheriff's Office)

communications.subject: Texas Public Information Act Request: Vehicular Pursuit Policy (Harris County Sheriff's Office)
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau

communications.subject: Public Information Request :: O096649-072323
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau: 
 
Thank you for your interest in public records of the Harris County Sheriff’s Office. Your request has been received and is being processed in accordance with Chapter 552 of Texas Government Code, the Public Information Act. Your request was given the reference number O096649-072323 for tracking purposes. 
 Records Request Details: 
Type of Records Requested: Other 
 
Your request will be forwarded to the relevant County department(s) to locate the information you seek and to determine the volume and any costs associated with satisfying your request. You will be contacted about the availability and/or provided with copies of the records in question. 
 PLEASE NOTE: The Texas Public Information Act does not require a governmental body to create new information, to do legal research, or to answer questions. 
 
 
Harris County Sheriff's Office

All current policies maintained by the department regarding vehicle pursuits (also known as: car chase, vehicular response policy, vehicular pursuit procedure, fleet crashes).

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Sincerely,

communications.subject: Public Records Request :: W012090-072423
communications.communication:
Dear Sydnee Coggins-Prioleau,

Thank you for using the RTK Open Records Center. 

Sincerely, 

Allegheny County
